content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    code_blocks = regexp.(md, r"\b\w+\s*\{.*?\}\b")
    cleaned_code_blocks = [clean_code_block(code_block) for code_block in code_blocks]
    joined_code = join(cleaned_code_blocks, "\n\n")
    return joined_code
end

function clean_code_block(code_block::String)
    # Remove code fences
    code_block = code_block[2:end-1]
    
    # Replace backslashes with double slashes and escape quotes
    code_block = replace(code_block, "\\" , "\\\\")
    code_block = replace(code_block, "'" , "\"")
    
    return code_block
end
```
Usage: `extract_julia_code("``\n# This is a comment\n\n## Example \n```julia\nfunction add(x::Int, y::Int) = x + y\n```")` returns `"# This is a comment\n\n## Example\nfunction add(x::Int, y::Int) = x + y"`
